bio: Philippe Etchebest is a French chef and television personality. He has been awarded two Michelin stars for his cooking and has hosted several cooking shows on French television.

recipes.name: Chocolate Gateau
recipes.cookingMethod: To make this Chocolate Gateau, preheat the oven to 180°C/350°F/Gas Mark 4 and grease and line an 8-inch round spring form cake tin with baking parchment. Melt chocolate either by placing it in a heatproof bowl over a saucepan of gently simmering water or microwaving it for 2-3 minutes. Cream together butter and sugar in a mixing bowl until light and fluffy, then gradually beat in eggs and add flour if the mixture begins to curdle. Fold in the remaining flour with the cooled, melted chocolate and milk, then spread the mixture into the cake tin and bake for 50-55 minutes. Once baked, cool the cake for 10 minutes before turning it out and cooling it completely.

recipes.name: French Lentils
recipes.cookingMethod: To cook French Lentils, start by heating oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Sauté chopped vegetables until they are softened, then add 6 cups of water, lentils, thyme, bay leaves, and salt. Bring the mixture to a boil and then reduce to a fast simmer. Cook lentils for 20-25 minutes until they are tender and have absorbed most of the water, draining any excess water if necessary. Serve immediately or allow to cool and reheat later. For a richer taste, substitute some of the water with chicken stock.

recipes.name: Coq au vin
recipes.cookingMethod: To make Coq au vin, start by frying bacon until crisp and then setting it aside. Brown shallots and chicken pieces in the same pan, before deglazing with brandy or Cognac and adding wine, stock, and tomato purée. Simmer the chicken with a bouquet garni, bacon, and shallots for 50 minutes to 1 hour. In a separate pan, fry mushrooms until golden and set aside. Remove the chicken from the pan and make a thickener with flour, olive oil, and butter, before whisking into the wine mixture and simmering for 1-2 minutes. Pour the sauce over the chicken, scatter with mushrooms and garnish with parsley.

bio: Dominique Ansel is a French-born pastry chef and inventor of the cronut, a croissant-doughnut hybrid pastry. He has won numerous awards for his pastry creations and has been named World's Best Pastry Chef by the World's 50 Best Restaurants.

recipes.name: Tuna Nicoise
recipes.cookingMethod: To make Tuna Nicoise, start by cooking potatoes in the oven with oil and seasoning until they are crisp, golden and cooked through. Meanwhile, boil eggs for 8-10 minutes and cool them in cold water. Then, whisk together oil, red wine vinegar, capers, and chopped tomatoes in a salad bowl and season to taste. Add onions, spinach, tuna, and the roasted potatoes, and toss together gently. Finally, top the salad with halved boiled eggs and serve immediately. Tuna Nicoise is a healthy and flavorful salad that makes a perfect light meal or side dish.

recipes.name: Beef Bourguignon
recipes.cookingMethod: To make Beef Bourguignon, preheat the oven to 325°F (165°C). Cut beef into 1-inch pieces and season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a Dutch oven or oven-safe pot over medium-high heat. Brown the beef in batches for 5-7 minutes per batch, remove and set aside. Add onions and carrots to the pot and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic, beef, red wine, beef broth, thyme, and bay leaves. Cover the pot and bake in the oven for 2.5-3 hours, until the beef is tender. Sauté the mushrooms in a separate pan until golden brown, then add to the pot and serve hot.

recipes.name: French Onion Soup
recipes.cookingMethod: To make French Onion Soup, melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add thinly sliced onions and cook until soft and caramelized, stirring occasionally for about 30 minutes. Sprinkle flour over the onions and stir to combine. Gradually pour in beef broth and red wine, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 20 minutes. Add a bay leaf, thyme, salt, and black pepper, and stir to combine. Preheat the oven to 400°F (205°C). Ladle the soup into oven-safe bowls and top with a slice of French bread and grated Gruyere cheese.

bio: Pierre Hermé is a French pastry chef and chocolatier. He is known for his innovative flavor combinations and has been named World's Best Pastry Chef by the World's 50 Best Restaurants. He has also authored several cookbooks on pastry and chocolate.

recipes.name: Chicken Parmentier
recipes.cookingMethod: To make Chicken Parmentier, start by preheating the oven to 200°C. Heat some oil in a large skillet and cook the chicken pieces until browned on all sides. Remove the chicken and set aside. In the same skillet, cook chopped onions, carrots, and celery until softened. Add minced garlic and tomato paste and cook for another minute. Pour in chicken broth and red wine and bring to a boil. Add the chicken back into the skillet, along with some herbs and spices, and simmer for 20-25 minutes. In a separate pot, boil potatoes until they are fork-tender.

recipes.name: Chocolate Souffle
recipes.cookingMethod: To make a chocolate souffle, preheat the oven to 190C/170C fan/gas 5. Grease a 1.2-litre souffle dish with butter, then coat with cocoa powder. Melt the chocolate and butter together in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water. In another bowl, whisk the egg yolks and sugar together until pale and thick. Add the chocolate mixture to the egg yolks and mix well. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Fold one-third of the egg whites into the chocolate mixture, then fold in the rest. Pour the mixture into the prepared dish, then smooth the surface.

recipes.name: Ratatouille
recipes.cookingMethod: To prepare the dish, start by cutting onions, bell peppers, eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes into bite-sized pieces. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat and sauté the onions and bell peppers until soft. Add the eggplant and continue cooking for 10 minutes until it has softened as well. Then add the zucchini, garlic, and tomatoes and cook for another 10 minutes. Add tomato paste and some vegetable broth, along with some herbs such as thyme and bay leaves, to the pot and stir to combine. Reduce the heat and let the mixture simmer for 20-25 minutes until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded together.

bio: Jacques Torres is a French pastry chef and chocolatier. He is known for his expertise in chocolate-making and has been awarded numerous accolades for his confections. He also hosts a cooking show on Food Network.

recipes.name: Flamiche
recipes.cookingMethod: Flamiche is a traditional French pastry filled with cheese and vegetables. To make Flamiche, first, preheat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Roll out the puff pastry on a floured surface to fit a 23cm tart tin. Press the pastry into the tin and prick the base all over with a fork. Bake the pastry blind for 10 mins, then remove the baking beans and parchment paper and bake for another 10 mins or until the pastry is golden and cooked through. In a frying pan, melt butter over medium heat and cook sliced onions until soft and golden, about 15-20 minutes. Add chopped leeks and cook for a further 5 minutes.

recipes.name: Duck Confit
recipes.cookingMethod: To make duck confit, preheat the oven to 225°F (107°C). Rinse the duck legs and pat them dry. Season with salt, pepper, and any desired herbs such as thyme or bay leaves. Place the duck legs in a large oven-safe dish or Dutch oven, skin side up. Melt enough duck fat in a saucepan to fully submerge the duck legs, then pour the melted fat over the legs. Cover the dish with foil or a lid and place in the oven for 3-4 hours, or until the meat is tender and falls off the bone. Remove from the oven and allow the duck to cool in the fat until it reaches room temperature. Once cool, transfer the duck legs to a container and pour the cooled fat over them to cover completely.

recipes.name: Summer Pistou
recipes.cookingMethod: To make Summer Pistou, start by heating olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add chopped onions, carrots, celery, and garlic, and sauté until the vegetables are softened. Next, add chopped tomatoes, zucchini, green beans, and diced potatoes to the pan. Pour in vegetable stock and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and let the vegetables simmer until they are tender. Add cooked white beans and a generous amount of fresh basil to the pan. Use a stick blender or food processor to blend the mixture until smooth. Serve the pistou hot with crusty bread, grated Parmesan cheese, and a drizzle of olive oil.

bio: Guy Savoy is a French chef who has been awarded three Michelin stars for his cooking. He is known for his modern take on French cuisine and has opened several restaurants around the world, including in Las Vegas and Singapore.

recipes.name: Brie Wrapped
recipes.cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Cut off the top rind of the Brie and set aside. Place the Brie in the center of a sheet of baking paper. Cover the top and sides of the Brie with prosciutto. Fold the paper over the top of the Brie and wrap tightly with string. Place the wrapped Brie on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes or until the prosciutto is crispy and the Brie is soft and gooey. While the Brie is cooking, slice the brioche into 1 cm thick slices and lightly toast them. Once the Brie is cooked, carefully remove the baking paper and prosciutto and place the Brie on a serving dish.

recipes.name: Boulangère Potatoes
recipes.cookingMethod: Boulangère Potatoes are a classic French dish that's easy to prepare. To make it, preheat the oven to 180°C/160°C fan/gas 4. Peel and slice 1kg of potatoes thinly and layer them in a baking dish. Add sliced onions and a generous amount of salt and pepper between the layers of potatoes. In a jug, mix 750ml hot chicken stock with 1 crushed garlic clove and pour over the potatoes. Cover the dish with foil and bake for 1 hour. Remove the foil and bake for another 30-45 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the top is crispy and golden.

recipes.name: Creme Brulee
recipes.cookingMethod: To make white chocolate creme brulee, preheat the oven to 150C/130C fan/gas 2. In a saucepan, heat the cream, milk, and vanilla extract over medium heat until it comes to a simmer. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks and sugar together until pale. Pour the hot cream mixture into the egg mixture and whisk well. Add the chopped white chocolate and stir until melted and smooth. Pour the mixture through a sieve into a jug. Divide the mixture between four ramekins and place them in a roasting tin. Pour hot water into the tin to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins.

bio: Alain Passard is a French chef and owner of the restaurant L'Arpège in Paris. He is known for his vegetable-focused cuisine and has been awarded three Michelin stars for his cooking. He also operates his own organic farm to supply ingredients for his restaurant.

recipes.name: Fennel Dauphinoise
recipes.cookingMethod: To make Fennel Dauphinoise, start by preheating your oven to 160°C. Finely slice 2 large fennel bulbs, discarding the tough outer layer. In a saucepan, heat 300ml double cream with 150ml milk, 2 crushed garlic cloves, and a sprig of thyme. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Layer the sliced fennel in a greased ovenproof dish, pour over the cream mixture and shake the dish to make sure the cream fills in the gaps. Cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for a further 30 minutes, or until the top is golden and the fennel is tender. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chicken Marengo
recipes.cookingMethod: To make Chicken Marengo, start by browning chicken pieces in a large pan with oil and butter. Remove the chicken and set it aside. In the same pan, sauté onions, garlic, and mushrooms until tender. Add diced tomatoes, chicken broth, and white wine to the pan and bring to a simmer. Return the chicken to the pan and simmer until cooked through. Stir in sliced olives and chopped parsley. Serve the Chicken Marengo with crusty bread or over cooked pasta. Garnish with additional parsley, if desired. This classic French dish is flavorful and satisfying, making it a perfect meal for any occasion.

recipes.name: Prawn & Fennel Bisque
recipes.cookingMethod: To make Prawn & Fennel Bisque, heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat, and cook diced fennel, onion, celery, and garlic until softened. Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, and chicken stock, and bring to a simmer. Add prawn heads and shells, and simmer for 20 minutes to make a stock. Strain the stock and discard the solids, and return the stock to the pan. Add diced potatoes, sliced fennel, and chopped prawn meat, and simmer until the potatoes are tender. Use a blender to puree the soup until smooth, then return it to the pan. Add cream, lemon juice, and seasonings to taste, and heat through.
